items.title: Jyske Bank initiates share repurchase programme
items.author: Jyske Bank
items.description: Jyske Bank has decided to repurchase up to DKK 2.25 billion worth of its own shares, with the purpose of reducing its share capital. The share repurchase programme will be handled independently by a financial adviser, Goldman Sachs, and will comply with relevant regulations.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: The company is taking steps to reduce its share capital, which can be seen as a positive move for shareholders as it may improve the company's financial position and efficiency.
Goldman Sachs has been appointed as the financial adviser and lead manager for the share repurchase programme, which is a standard role for an investment bank in such transactions.
